events.name: TechLadies Launch Party
events.description:
TechLadies is a community-led initiative that teaches women how to code by having them create applications for non-profit organizations, pro bono, in a structured 6 - 8 weeks program. To enroll for this program, please apply at http://www.techladies.co/

Join us at our launch party at Facebook's new swanky office! You will hear from the non-profit organizations on what exciting projects TechLadies' participants will be working on. You will also hear about what’s it like to be in the tech industry from our panel of local and overseas speakers!

Speakers include:
Michelle Sun, CEO and Co-Founder of First Code Academy
Ludwine Probst, Software Developer
Hui Jing Chen, Software Developer
Aislinn Chen, Founder of Coding Girls

Seats are limited and dinner is provided. We are unable to accept walk-ins due to security reasons, please register your interest on eventbrite and do so early. 

See you there!

events.name: Bachav Workshop -  Linux server lockdown aka Linux server hardeniing
events.description:
We are pleased to inform our first bachav workshop on Linux Hardening by Michael Rebultan.  Please note, this event is hands-on, we can accommodate only few selected participants. If you get selected, you will receive a mail from bachav champion by 20th January 2015. Selection Criteria: Selection ( 15-20 persons only ) will be based on the following two criteria: 1. Contribution to the community. Speakers, humla, bachav champions, core team and venue hosts will get priority to the workshop.  2. Passion towards Information security + the attendance in previous meet ups.  If you are new to the community, selection will be based on the answers to the survey questions asked during the registration process. 


Agenda: Most of the Pentesters and Hackers are using Linux machines in their activities. But less knew how to hardened their own Linux servers on the OS level which they mainly rely on their Network security appliances.   In this workshop, we will showcase the real practices in a financial database environment in compliance with the industry standard certification such as PCI-DSS and SOX audit.  The techniques will cater for different types of administrator: -  Beginners - IPTABLES tips and tricks  Intermediate - The beauty of Kernel Parameters  Advanced - Chillax mode SysAdmin  With a bonus of Project Management technique for SysAdmin and InfoSec.  


Who should attend: Anyone who is interested in the securing their linux machines. What should I bring with me: Your own laptop, with latest version of CentOS in a virtual machine. 


Null humla champion: Michael Rebultan has 13 years of experience as a Linux SysAdmin. Security compliance practitioner on both PCI-DSS and SOX audit. Certified Freediver and a Lead investigator from The Order of Exorcists. Please reach out to Bachav champion, if you have any questions regarding the event.
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Maker Faire Singapore 2016 - Maker Townhall
events.location: SUTD Singapore University of Technology & Design, Think Tank 15, Building 1, Level 5

events.name: Designing Education For The Next Generation | The Orange Hive Community
events.description:
Education can help us do amazing things -from new ways to tackle the same problems to living a fulfilling life of curiosity and growth; from getting one out of the poverty cycle to creating the next ground breaking invention.

But at what point is one considered an educated person?

Is there a threshold for learning?

How are institutions imparting knowledge differently and effectively?

And finally, how would education look like in the future?

Join us for our upcoming cozy 2.5 hours session to design education for the next generation!

Date: 27th Jan 2016 (Wed)

Time: 7:00pm to 9:30pm

Venue: To be sent after confirmation

RSVP: http://tinyurl.com/oh-future-edu

Door Fee: $10

Max intake: 16 pax

*Dinner provided*

see you there!
--------------
WHAT'S NEW IN 2016?

We're trying out a new approach in our hands-on learning at Orange Hive: Reflective and self-directed learning on a topic which the community is curious about.

Facilitated deep discussion, simple worksheet and some cross- pollination of insights over dinner! Follow us on The Orange Hive Community to stay updated!

events.name: Hackware v1.4
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on.

Agenda & Talks for this meetup:

From our venue hosts - 
(5min) PongCam: IoT for Smart Office - Poh Kah Kong and Chew Kai Kok from IDA Singapore GDS Team

1. (20min) Design for Manufacturing - Daniël J Ellis
2. (10min) autonomous indoor robot with ROS - Juan Miguel Jimeno (and a new user group: http://www.meetup.com/Singapore-ROS-Meetup/)
3. (10min) IoT hardware with Meteor Javascript - Rick Behl
4. (10min) What has India got to do with the Maker Movement? - Kenneth Lim
5. (5min) Remote control BB8 - Teo Tian Lye
6. (2min) Protable writing device - Nicholas Ang

7. Announcements by anyone on:
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

8. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members

Talks : ~20mins
Talks typically include side projects of speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things and much more. We want to hear about an electronics project that you already implemented at home or anywhere.

Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Lightning talks are short electronics demo that are working or even incomplete. With 5 minutes it is a great time to get feedback from the audience and improve on it. We wanna see all your fried chips and electronics to be fixed. Nothing has to be perfect - we are all learning. Bring them!

Announcements: ~1min
Announcement can be done by anyone looking to get hired or hire someone. Talk about your project / company and tell us who you are looking for.

Venue sponsors: Thank you IDA Singapore, Sandcrawler
events.location: IDA Hive, Sandcrawler, 1 Fusionopolis View, #08-01, Singapore 138577
